meanings.definition: A book in which records of money received and paid out are kept.
meanings.sent1: I keep all my financial transactions organized in my cashbooks.
meanings.sent2: The accountant diligently updates the cashbooks every day.
meanings.sent3: When the cashbooks started talking, everyone was surprised!
meanings.sent4: Her cashbooks were like a treasure map, guiding her through her expenses.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out cashbooks told the story of a year's worth of spending.

meanings.sent1: I need to cashbooks all the recent transactions before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She cashbooks all the sales at the end of each shift.
meanings.sent3: If you cashbooks too quickly, you might make mistakes.
meanings.sent4: He cashbooks his memories in the pages of his journal.
meanings.sent5: The pen danced across the page as she cashbooks the latest expenses.
